sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A church-covenant lawfull and needfull to be entred-into by all, that intend to walk in church-fellowship according to gospel-order having tasted the sweetness of that everlasting covenant God in Christ hath made with His people, ordered in all things and sure, and can say of it as David did, tasting his words as he did, sweeter than the honey, the first droppings of the honey-combe, this is all my salvation, and all my desire. Woodward, Ezekias, 1590-1675.
[14], 38 p.
Printed by M.S. for Henry Cripps ..., London : 1656.
Dedication signed: Hezekiah Woodward. Imperfect: print show-through. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library
=======
A church-covenant lawfull and needfull to be entred-into by all, that intend to walk in church-fellowship according to gospel-order having tasted the sweetness of that everlasting covenant God in Christ hath made with His people, ordered in all things and sure, and can say of it as David did, tasting his words as he did, sweeter than the honey, the first droppings of the honey-combe, this is all my salvation, and all my desire. Woodward, Ezekias, 1590-1675.
[14], 38 p.
Printed by M.S. for Henry Cripps ..., London : 1656.
Dedication signed: Hezekiah Woodward. Imperfect: print show-through. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library
